questions.question: There are 3 types of production.  What are they?

choices.answer: Job, batch and flow
Just in time, batch and flow
Job batch and process
Job, batch and finish

questions.question: Job production can best be described as ...

choices.answer: Creating one thing at a time
Adding things to an item on a production line
Creating lots of similar items at one time
Creating a unique item to meet customer specifications

questions.question: Flow production can best be described as ...

choices.answer: Produces single items from start to finish
Used to mass produce identical items
Where parts are added to the item on a production line
Produces items that are always different

questions.question: Batch production can best be described as ....

choices.answer: Often used for producing foods such as bread and soup
Can produce large quantities of identical prioducts
Requires skilled workers
Is labour intensive

questions.question: Job production often results in high worker motivation because ....

choices.answer: Workers are unskilled
Jobs the workers do are repetitive and boring
Workers are paid well
Workers are highly skilled

questions.question: High quality is important because ......

choices.answer: Poor quality results in customer complaints
Poor quality wasted raw materials
High quality results in customer complaints
High quality results in wasted raw materials

questions.question: If you have high quality goods and services you can ....

choices.answer: Keep your costs up
Get satisfaction in your work
keep your profits low
Charge more for you products or services

questions.question: Quality circles ........

choices.answer: Involve workers in solving production problems
Are where managers tell workers what to do
Look at how to replace workers with machines
Do not affect the quality process

questions.question: Benchmarking is ......

choices.answer: Where you do nothing to improve your quality
Where you try to match the quality of the best producer
where everyone votes of the quality process
Is where you count and record wasted items

questions.question: Quality assurance can best be described as ......

choices.answer: Is not important to a business
Needs all workers to be making sure that quality is high
Getting quality right at every stage in the process
Does not affect quality of finished items

questions.question: People who work in job production are usually .....

choices.answer: Highly skilled
Work by themselves or in a small team
Motivated
All of these answers

questions.question: Batch production can usually be described as ........

choices.answer: Slow because there are lots of unskilled workers
Capital intensive
Labour intensive
Fast because there are lots of skilled workers

questions.question: You can combine flow and batch production

choices.answer: All of the time
Never
Some of the time
Depends on the product being produced

questions.question: Can you check the quality of services using the same methods you use to check production?

choices.answer: Yes you can apply the same methods
You don't have to check quality of services provided
No it is not possible you have to use other methods
You can combine production methods with things like surveys

questions.question: Picking suppliers what would you look for?

choices.answer: Price of raw materials
Quality raw materials
All of these options
Reliability

questions.question: Automation describes ..................

choices.answer: A production process carried out almost totally by machines
A production process carried out with no machines
A production process carried out to make a unique item
A production process carried out factory workers & machines

questions.question: Operating systems (production systems) have

choices.answer: Workers, machines and outputs
Inputs workers and machines
Uses no machines to produce the output
Inputs, a process and outputs

questions.question: Which 3 factors would you consider when looking at a suppliers prices?

choices.answer: What other suppliers are charging
What your competitors are charging their customers
Value for money, discounts, extended credit terms
The price you charge the customer

questions.question: Overstocking can be a problem because ..............

choices.answer: It costs money to keep stock secure and in good condition
If you have too much stock too much money is tied up unused
The stock might go out of date or perish before you use it
All of these answers

questions.question: Under-stocking can be a problem because .........

choices.answer: You have to stop production because you run out of stock
All of these answers
You might have higher admin costs ordering more often
Customers might complain if their orders are not met
